thread.title: Artist G.KERO Explains Her Shirt Painting Process in this Gorgeous Short Video
thread.title_full: Artist G.KERO Explains Her Shirt Painting Process in this Gorgeous Short Video

author: Graeme Campbell
title: Artist G.KERO Explains Her Shirt Painting Process in this Gorgeous Short Video
text:
Operating under the moniker of G.KERO, painter Marguerite Bartherotte perfectly captures the art-fashion symbiosis.
While searching for alternatives to traditional gallery canvases, Marguerite happened upon the idea of drawing on apparel. ‚ÄúI started by drawing handsome boyfriends that I didn‚Äôt have, and then I drew pretty girls on their T-shirts,‚Äù says the La Cambre arts school alumnus. With the help of her siblings, the G.KERO brand was established in 2011. From there, the bohemian Bartherotte has carved a niche as one of the most idiosyncratic designers to have emerged out of France in recent years.
These days, G.KERO can be found on the racks of famous stores the world over. Superstars such as Kate Moss, Cara Delevingne, Elle Fanning, and Marion Cotillard have all been pictured in the get-up, while Daft Punk, David Bowie, The Beatles, and Karl Lagerfeld are just a few of the famous references featured on G.KERO apparel.
Sound that Cara never leave our supersexbombs printed shirt #caradelevingne #gkero #supersexbombshirt #beautiful #maldivesbeachparty 
A photo posted by G.KERO (@gkeroparis) on Dec 5, 2016 at 1:02pm PST 

"Wear something that make thou beautiful and special" is not on The Book but should be. #kendalljenner #gkero #birdsshirt

Mother to son #gkero #cute #marioncotillard #kid #weartheoriginal

News from L.A // Last summer she had picked up our birds shirt here she is wearing our free animals blouse // So cute with #gkero #ellefanning ‚ù§Ô∏è #hollywood #bestdressedinhollywood ‚ú®üòâüòç

We have just discovered this googling gkero : Beautiful Elle Fanning in Paris wearing our shirt ! Thank you Elle for flying our birds #gkero #ellefanning #birds #paris #hollywood

Kate Moss with our Kamasutra shirt rocking a shop dummy #gkero #katemoss 
A photo posted by G.KERO (@gkeroparis) on Aug 21, 2014 at 7:32am PDT 

For our latest piece of original Highsnobiety TV content, we pitched up in the City of Lights for a one-on-one meeting with Marguerite. Here, she explained her working practices, inspiration, and future ambitions for the brand.
Check out the footage above, and then catch our visit to Iceland‚Äôs frosty arctic lands.
